headline: Robinhood, Applovin jump as S&P 500 reshuffle boosts index entrants
summary: Investing.com -- Shares of Robinhood Markets Inc (NASDAQ:HOOD) surged 7.1% in after-hours trading Friday, following the announcement of its inclusion in the S&P 500 index. The trading platform is joined by Applovin Corp (NASDAQ:APP), which climbed 7.4%, and EMCOR Group Inc (NYSE:EME), up 2.6%, highlighting investor enthusiasm after S&P Dow Jones Indices unveiled sweeping changes to its major benchmarks.

raw.headline: Robinhood, Applovin jump as S&P 500 reshuffle boosts index entrants
raw.summary: Investing.com -- Shares of Robinhood Markets Inc (NASDAQ:HOOD) surged 7.1% in after-hours trading Friday, following the announcement of its inclusion in the S&P 500 index. The trading platform is joined by Applovin Corp (NASDAQ:APP), which climbed 7.4%, and EMCOR Group Inc (NYSE:EME), up 2.6%, highlighting investor enthusiasm after S&P Dow Jones Indices unveiled sweeping changes to its major benchmarks.

headline: AppLovin, Robinhood, and Emcor Rally on News They Will Join the S&P 500. Here’s Who Didn’t Make the Cut.
summary: AppLovin Robinhood Markets  and  Emcor Group  will join the S&P 500 index later in September in conjunction with the index’s quarterly rebalancing, according to S&P Dow Jones Indices, which oversees the benchmark index.  Applovin and Robinhood have often been mentioned as candidates for inclusion this year, because they were among the largest companies by market capitalization not in the S&P 500 index.  Applovin stock was up 6.3% in after-hours trading to $521.01, while Robinhood was up 6.4% to $107.75 and Emcor was 2.2% higher at $639.

raw.headline: AppLovin, Robinhood, and Emcor Rally on News They Will Join the S&P 500. Here’s Who Didn’t Make the Cut.

Applovin stock was up 6.3% in after-hours trading to $521.01, while Robinhood was up 6.4% to $107.75 and Emcor was 2.2% higher at $639.

headline: AppLovin, Robinhood Markets and Emcor Group Set to Join S&P 500; Others to Join S&P 100, S&P MidCap 400 and S&P SmallCap 600
summary: S&P Dow Jones Indices ("S&P DJI") will make the following changes to the S&P 100, S&P 500, S&P MidCap 400, and S&P SmallCap 600 indices effective prior to the open of trading on Monday, September 22, to coincide with the quarterly rebalance. The changes ensure each index is more representative of its market capitalization range. The companies being removed from the S&P SmallCap 600 are no longer representative of the small-cap market space.

raw.headline: AppLovin, Robinhood Markets and Emcor Group Set to Join S&P 500; Others to Join S&P 100, S&P MidCap 400 and S&P SmallCap 600
raw.summary: S&P Dow Jones Indices ("S&P DJI") will make the following changes to the S&P 100, S&P 500, S&P MidCap 400, and S&P SmallCap 600 indices effective prior to the open of trading on Monday, September 22, to coincide with the quarterly rebalance. The changes ensure each index is more representative of its market capitalization range. The companies being removed from the S&P SmallCap 600 are no longer representative of the small-cap market space.

summary: Robinhood Markets, the retail brokerage that became synonymous with the meme-stock craze, is set to join the S&P 500. S&P Dow Jones Indices said Friday it would add the company, along with others, to the benchmark index on Sept.

headline: Robinhood to join S&P 500 in watershed moment for US fintech sector
summary: The inclusion, announced by S&P Dow Jones Indices on Friday, is expected to boost demand for Robinhood's stock as index-tracking funds adjust their holdings.  It also underscores Robinhood's evolution from a pandemic-era trading upstart to a company with sustained influence in the U.S. financial markets.

headline: Robinhood (HOOD) Stock Trades Down, Here Is Why
summary: Shares of financial services company Robinhood (NASDAQ:HOOD) fell 2.3% in the afternoon session after a weak U.S. jobs report sparked broader economic concerns, affecting brokerage firms and banks. The disappointing labor market data raised worries about the health of the economy, which could lead to reduced trading activity on platforms like Robinhood. Furthermore, the report led to speculation about potential interest rate cuts, a development that can put pressure on financial companies.

headline: 1 High-Flying Stock with Impressive Fundamentals and 2 We Turn Down
summary: Expensive stocks typically earn their valuations through superior growth rates that other companies simply can’t match. The flip side though is that these lofty expectations make them particularly susceptible to drawdowns when market sentiment shifts.
